text:
Raskolnikov thrust his notice at the head clerk. 

“Wait a minute,” the clerk replied, attending to a lady in mourning. 

Raskolnikov breathed easier. “It can’t be that!”

He urged himself to stay calm. 

“It’s stifling in here,” he muttered. “Makes my head spin.” 

A storm brewed inside him. He feared losing control. 

He tried to focus on the clerk. 

The young man, dressed smartly, spoke French to a foreigner. 

“Luise Ivanovna, you can sit down,” he said to the lady. 

She remained standing, her purple face blotchy. 

Raskolnikov watched, tension tightening in his chest.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences inner turmoil and anxiety while waiting in a stifling office filled with various people.
